text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with gorgonzola cream sauce
that's right tis the season for rich
creamy sauces and there seems to be a
little confusion about what exactly is a
cream sauce and how is it different from
a white sauce and this bechamel you keep
talking about and while there's many
things that it's okay to be confused
about like why are there so many Real
Housewife shows one thing you shouldn't
be confused about is cream sauces okay
so let me show you how to do one and I'm
pretty sure you're going to be shocked
at just how easy it is so step one
because we're doing a gorgonzola cream
sauce we're going to prep some
gorgonzola and buy prep I mean crumble
and for that we're going to use some
good old fashioned fork on fork action
we're going to take two forks I'm going
to crumble that cheese and to make this
easier you can pop that cheese in the
freezer for about 10 minutes like I did
and it really crumbles a lot easier and
you can use your fingers but gorgonzola
is super sticky and you will get the
dreaded BCF blue cheese fingers which is
an affliction we've covered in previous
videos but this works great so we're
going to crumble that up we're going to
set that aside and it's on to the how to
make a cream sauce portion of the
program so we're gonna place a heavy
skillet on medium heat and we're going
to pour in one cup of heavy whipping
cream and we're going to bring that up
to a simmer and we're going to reduce
that stirring occasionally about half
until it's lightly thickens and your
cream sauce is done any questions and
that sounds like a joke but it's really
not a true cream sauce is nothing more
than reduced cream it's not thinking
with any ruse or cornstarch s or
anything like that by the way in the
restaurant we're doing this on high heat
it's boiling like crazy it only is going
to take like a minute or two but at home
we have the luxury of time so don't feel
like you have to rush this but anyway
keep simmering it on medium until its
viscosity resembles this alright so you
can see it's not super thick
it's just reduced and thickened up
slightly and at that point our cream is
ready for our pasta which ideally you're
boiling right now right next to it and
while we're waiting we might as well
season it up a little bit I'm going to
go with a pinch of salt not too much the
cheese will add salt so we'll just for
that later
also a little black pepper little shake
cayenne give that a stir and then like I
said all we're waiting for is the pasta
so try to time the pasta for being done
shortly after your cream sauce has
reduced and really anything
is going to work before gorgonzola sauce
I really like a stuffed pasta like a
tortellini or ravioli I'm gonna try this
sample of mini ravioli that apparently
have some kind of squash filling so
we'll see how those are but like I said
I think any stuffed pasta is going to
work beautifully with this so we're
going to cook our pasta we're going to
add it to our reduced cream we're going
to put our heat on low and we'll give
that a mix alright so our cream is hot
our pasta is obviously hot like I said
our gas is on low because we want to
make sure everything's nice and hot when
we add our cheese which is the next step
so we're going to go ahead and dump in
our gorgonzola crumbles and we're going
to mix that in and just keep tossing
that over low heat until it disappears
and by the way at any point you're doing
this you want to thin that out with some
reserved pasta liquid that boiling water
just drizzle a little in and that works
perfectly to adjust the texture of your
sauce and it really is ok if it seems a
hair thin in the pan because as soon as
you serve this up in your bowls it
really does tighten up as it cools and
then once our gorgonzola has melted in
or virtually melted in it's okay if
there's still a few unmelted crumbles
those are going to melt but this point
we're gonna give it one last taste for
salt you are always have been and always
will be the boss of your sauce so just
those seasonings at that point we're
going to finish off with a little bit of
freshly chopped Italian parsley or you
want to turn your heat off at this point
and I do like to finish with a little
dusting of parmesan I know there's
gorgonzola in it but I do like that
extra little hint of saltiness a little
bit of nutty savoriness that parmesan
always adds so integrate some of that in
I'm going to stir that in and we are
ready to dish this up make sure you use
warm bowls and you can see that amazing
creamy gorgonzola sauce enveloping that
pasta and yes it's a very rich sauce but
there's not a ton of it it's just barely
coating the surface and that would be
absolutely fantastic just like that but
we're going to autumn this up a little
bit with some sweet diced apples and
some crunchy toasted walnuts a little
bit of parsley and that is done mini
squash ravioli with a gorgonzola cream
sauce and by the way if you think I'm
nuts for putting nuts on my pasta I
think you're nuts for not putting nuts
on your pasta I'm glad I get that off my
chest
because it really is delicious that
little bit of crunch with that sweet
Apple just a perfect balance with that
rich gorgonzola cream sauce just a
beautiful autumn pasta and I thought it
would make a great excuse
to show you just how basic and simple a
real cream sauce is and again there's
only a couple ingredients in this so
there's not a lot to screw up so I
really do hope you give this a try head
over to food wishes comm for all the
ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
